name: Hard General Knowledge 14 Quiz / Test | Mixed 25 Questions | 25 Questions

questions.text: Which animal is the biggest of the marsupials?
How many of the following birds can fly: ostrich, cassowary, emu and rhea?
Born 18th May 1920, how was Karol Wojtyla better known?
Which comedian's characteristic deadpan expression earned him the nickname 'The Great Stone Face'?
Name the 1980 film starring Goldie Hawn as an army recruit: 'Private___'?
Who was born at 17 Bruton Street, London on 21 April 1926 at 2.40am and was delivered by Caesarean section after the birth developed some complications?
Who has a boyfriend called Ham Gravy?
questions.explanation:
Olive Oyl.

	Popeye quickly became the principal and most popular character in the strip.

questions.text: What were the nationalities of the famous composers Brahms and Liszt?
questions.explanation:
German and Hungarian.

	Johannes Brahms and Franz Liszt.  'Brahms and Liszt' became part of rhyming slang and refers to a person being the worse for alcohol.  Work it out.

questions.text: Who was the mistress of Bill Sikes in 'Oliver Twist'?
The woodchuck is the alternative name for which animal?
In the film 'The Nutty Professor', what is the name of Eddie Murphy's slim-line alter ego?
When the adrenal glands release adrenaline for example on a rollercoaster ride, which of the following is incorrect?
questions.explanation:
The skin receives more blood.

	A rollercoaster ride gives you a pale, sweaty skin as the skin receives less blood and goes pale.

questions.text: The Galapagos Islands belong to Ecuador. Galapagos is Spanish for what?
questions.explanation:
Tortoise.

	The Spanish word for equator is Ecuador.

questions.text: What is the device used by the police to burst car tyres?
The shofar is one of the world's oldest musical instruments. It is a ram's horn blown from which building on Holy days?
Name the closed, four-wheeled horse-drawn carriage having a glass front?
questions.explanation:
Clarence.

	Named after the Duke of Clarence (1765-1837) who became William IV.

questions.text: What type of motorway is an 'autostrada'?
questions.explanation:
Italian.

	'Autobahn' is a German motorway and 'autopista' is a Spanish motorway.

questions.text: The thorny devil is a strange-looking lizard that lives in which desert?
questions.explanation:
Australian.

	It is also known as the spiney lizard and feeds on ants caught with the tongue.

questions.text: Who was awarded the Pulitzer Prize for the novel 'The Good Earth' on 2 May 1932?
In the Bible whose wife was Zipporah?
On 17 October 1931, Al 'Scarface' Capone was jailed for tax evasion. How many years was he sentenced to?
'Slippery Frank' Cline was whose bodyguard?
Which country produces about half of the world's emeralds?
In 1918 Russia introduced the Gregorian calendar which was already used by most of the Western world. Which Pope introduced this solar dating system in 1582?
Klaicha are small pastries stuffed with dates and dusted with sugar and are a popular food in this country where date palms are widely grown?
questions.explanation:
Iraq.

	Hope you enjoyed the quiz.
